intro: Senecio ghiesbreghtii var. pauciflorus, commonly known as the sparse-flowered senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
